chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Marie D. Berg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marie D. Berg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Criminal Case Settlement & Elements attached

Case called at 11:38 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Marie D. Berg in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS Count to resisting an officer, contrary to 946.41(1), a Class A Misdemeanor

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1 as AMENDED and Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
Upon questioning of the Court, due to arguments by counsel and allegations in the complaint, Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Miss Berg is competent.
After colloquy with Miss Berg, the Court finds no concerns

On Counts #1 & #2, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 15 months, each count, with conditions:
--Mental Health Evaluation
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--To pay statutory costs $486
--To pay $400 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 11:58 am
Status conference on July 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 22, 2016 at 09:40 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Marie D. Berg
Current: 3 N.4th St., Fort Atkinson, WI 53538 United States  (Effective: 05-20-2016)
Prior: 408 Barrie St, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

Case called at 9:30am [mo]
Defendant Marie D. Berg in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1500   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Daniel Jones
(*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 

recess:9:33am
